comments.body: This whiteboard is maintained by the placement coordinator if I am not wrong. Cannot say anything about the exact numbers but mostly seems right and what is expected from the student maintained spreadsheet.
Are ppos counted here?
this was 3-4 months ago

I don't maintain this, so no clue. Another thing to note is that this also does not account for returning offers (people who joined as interns but received a full time offer based on their performance)
What are the stats now? Can u plz provide them if u have..

>(people who joined as interns but received a full time offer based on their performance)

Isn't that what a ppo is
Not exactly. PPOs are given after completion of summer internships. You could argue they function similarly but PPOs also mostly require you to return for spring internships the next year.
How are the percentages 52.8% and 60.1% for CSE EC and CSE RR? Shouldn't they be 45% and 51%? Can anyone explain this?
Yes these are somewhat old but I don't think it would've changed much because of FTE conversions.
"Total" in the bottom table means total number of students in the branch but placement percentage is calculate based on number of eligible students. You can verify it with the above table.
oh! Thanks bro
but why bro this time placement is very low ?
These are pretty damn bad wtf I thought pes was good, I know we're going through bad market conditions but this is sad
True man, the stats were so good last year, it had around 15 lpa median for cse.. It decreased to 12 this year..
recession bro
is placement season ended or ongoing?
Bro these stats are similar to tier 2 nits, idk what else you expected lol
No lol not even close, the average might be similar but close to everybody gets placed at least. Look at the placement percentage it's literally sad wtf even with 9+ cg people didn't get placed
Check out nit kkr 2024 cse placements and see for yourself
I did, it's on their website. It's nowhere as bad as this, only 9 people in cs and IT aren't placed and the average is higher
